pageContent.descriptionText:
Meeting with Dr. Cardonza – Exploring Areas of Value CreationDr. Cardonza

"Don’t get me wrong – medical advances are important. However, I’m also not one to jump on the bandwagon of trying every new diagnostic test, every new medical device, and every new drug just for the sake of mistakenly being considered “advanced” or “state-of-the-art.” Before I adopt anything new, I want to be certain that the benefit to my patients will outweigh the risk and extra expense. It’s also desirable to have protocols or some guidelines for patient selection in place to evaluate the benefit versus the risk. Once I know it’s in the best interest of my patients, I’m on it. In marketing terms, I guess I’m what you might call a “fast follower”.”
